messages.title: THE CONSERVATIVES CHOICES FOR THE NEXT ELECTION
messages.content: These are tough times for families. We have to cut the deficit, but we have to do it fairly. Labour will halve the deficit in four years by taking tough action, such as raising the top rate of tax for those earning over £150,000 and freezing pay for the top civil service earners.

messages.title: Under the Tories
messages.content: The Losers - FAMILIES WITH KIDS AND EARNING MORE THAN £16,040 WILL LOSE £1,000. The Winners - MILLIONAIRES STAND TO GAIN A £200,000 INHERITANCE TAX CUT.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will not claim expenses for anything outside of running his local constituency office.
Will be a strong voice for the re-opening of the March-Wisbech train line.
Will hold regular surgery in Wisbech, March, Chatteris, Whittlesey and Littleport.
Will stand up for what local residents want, including defending our NHS, local schools and getting more police on the streets.
Will offer 25 percent of his Westminster salary to local community groups.
Unlike the Tories, he will not vote to end the Hunting Act.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Labour can beat the Tories here.

issues.economy: Labour will halve the deficit in four years by taking tough action, such as raising the top rate of tax for those earning over £150,000 and freezing pay for the top civil service earners.
issues.socialWelfare: George Osborne, Tory Shadow Chancellor, has now made his choice too. He has chosen to take tax credits away from middle-income families. He has chosen to take Child Trust Funds for 900,000 children every year. He has chosen to take £1,000 in direct payments from families earning over £16,040 with two children.

images.caption: Graph showing the result of 2005 General Election indicating Labour as the only viable alternative to Conservatives.
